pros: There is not one single pro going for this company. They should be investigated and shut down. Oh wait. They have a great business name.
cons: They avoid paying until the very last minute. And even after they agree to pay you, it's still like pulling teeth. I needed to use the client to pressure them to pay me. Won't answer phones or emails. Don't think they actually have a base in USA.
advice_to_mgmt: Weighing all my options. Law suit is definitely at the top of the list. Start paying your employees or you won't be around too much longer. Only gave them one star because I couldn't leave the review without a rating. They actually deserve none.

review_title: Company cannot meet its Account Payable and Contractual Obligations

The accounts payable dept does not pick up the phone or answer any emails when asked about payments. Getting ready to take legal action against the company.
Beware when working with this company they treat people poorly!!

Mr. Akash is my Consultant Care Associate..... Akash has been a great help to me since I joined, he helped me with the onboarding process, and get my paperwork in line. pros: Cool work atmosphere, full freedom to employees. Nice increments. They are distributing cars, TV, phones etc. to achievers. I am amazed to see such a care...!!
cons: Every organization has both pros and cons but in case of TRG pros outweighs cons. There could be some improvements like providing bit flexibility in work hours but overall a good company to work for if you are looking to make your career.

pros: Since most recruiters get paid when they get you work- they work hard to seal the deal. As the talent- you don't pay them a dime during any part of the process- that's all handled by the employer
cons: There's a good chance that a recruiter will try to inch you in at the same amount or just a tiny bit more than what you were making at your last job when you really deserve more. The best way to prevent this from happening is to talk to multiple recruiters to find out what you are worth
